children.name: window
children.definition: a space or an area of glass in the wall of a building or vehicle that lets in light : cửa sổ
examples: out of/from/through the window
She looked out of the window to see if it was raining.
The sun was shining through the windows.
in the window(= just inside a window )
We were looking at the Christmas displays in theshop windows.
open a windowI opened the window and breathed in the fresh air.
close/shut a windowShe shut the window firmly.
roll up/down a window(= open or shut the window in a car )Lucy rolled the window down and waved to him.
look/gaze/stare out of the windowMom stared out of the window at the road.
types of windows
picture window[C] a large window made of a single piece of glass positioned so that you can see an attractive viewcửa sổ lớn
a picture window overlooking the garden
casement/ casement window[C] a type of window that is fixed on one side and opens like a door :cửa sổ hai cánh
fanlight/ transom (window)US [C]especially UKa small window above a door or a larger window:cửa bán nguyệt,cửa sổ hình quạt
A flight of granite steps leads to a front door with a fanlight.
French doors, double-hung windows, and transom windows face the garden.
bay window[C] a window that sticks out from the wall of a house, usually with glass on three sides :cửa sổ nhô ra
bow window[C]a curved bay window:cửa sổnhô ra (cong)
A bow window provides panoramic views over the lake.
dormer (window)[C] a window sticking out from a sloping roof :cửa sổ ở mái nha
The bright master bedroom has a dormer window to the front and a second window to the side.
lattice window[C] a window made from small pieces of glass which are held in place by metal strips:cửa sổ mắt cáo
leaded window[ C ] a window made from small pieces of glass fixed together with lead stripscửa sổ có ô kính viền chì
rose windowa round window, especially in a church, with coloured glass in it:cửa sổ tròn hình hoa hồng
sash windowa window which has two frames fixed one above the other that open by being moved up and down :cửa sổ có hai khung kính trượt
storm windowan extra door or window which is fitted to the usual door or window for protection in bad weather :cửa sổ bên ngoài
openA breeze from the open window lifted her hair.
closed/shutAll the windows were closed.
a front windowI don't want people looking in my front window.
a back windowThe burglar had got in through one of the back windows.
the rear window(= the back window, especially of a car )The car's rear window had been bashed in.
a shop/store windowShe looked in shop windows.
sb’s bedroom/office windowFrom his bedroom window he could see two men having an argument.
the kitchen/car etc windowShe had left the kitchen window open.
a stained glass window(= made of pieces of coloured glass )The church has fine medieval stained glass windows.
the window frameThe window frame was rotten.

children.name: shutter
examples: 1[C usually P] a wooden cover on the outside of a window which prevents light or heat from going into a room or heat from leaving it
Shutters usually come in pairs and are hung like doors on hinges.
2a metal covering which protects the windows andentrance of a shop from thieves when it is closed
shuttered[adj]
Shops are closed and shuttered on Sundays.

children.name: skylight
children.definition: a window built into a roof to allow light in : cửa sổ mái
examples: Putting in a skylight made the attic seem big and bright.

children.name: glaze
children.definition: to put a piece of glass into a window or the windows of a building :lắp kính
examples: The house is nearly finished but it hasn't been glazed yet.
glazed[adj]lắp kính
all the rooms have glazed doors.
glazing[U] the glass used for windows : kính cửa
sealed protective glazing
Today's building codes in most areas of the country generally require insulated glazing.
